Rationale: In the given scenario, the red player has his meeple placed on a road segement that is incompletes, spreading across 2 tiles. According to the game rules, an incomplete road is scored at 1 point per tile it spans. Therefore, the red player will earn 2 points for his meeple on the incomplete road (2 tiles * 1 point each = 2 points). The blue player has his meeple placed on the monastry, which is surrounded by 3 tiles. According to the game rules, a incomplete monastry get 1 point for the monastry tile itself and 1 point for each surrounding tile.
